In this n? n H^Qt^ n +% may I a ^' please » if it is desired that the countries of destination should be stated a little more definitely than oaudi-Arabia, the Yemen, and other parts of Arabia'? It is possible that there may be exports hence to Kuwait, the Trucial Oman, and, remotely, to Muscat; and it might be thought desirable ot k e r Arab States to be specifically mentioned, although it would entail additional clerical work. I' ^ ^ as been agreed that the format of the statistical forms supplied by Yourself is somewhat out-of-date; and it is understood that before it is proposed to indent for a new supply the form should be designed afresh. In view of the distinction now desired between exports and re-exports, would it be thought suitable that this new form might be designed now, please ? 'M- OF CUSTOMS, and PORT OFFICER. Total value of Exports to Prineipal Countries from the Bahrain Islands for the month of 19 iiH- contd.Tne alteration was suggested because we thought that it would save the customs staff extra labour if they included in their monthly returns the exports and re exports from Bahrain to Saudli Araoia and the Yemen, thus enabling us to prepare our monthly returns to the Ministry of Economics, London us well as our annual trade reports. The customs, however are now sending us a separate return for the exports to Saudi Arabia and the Yemen it apoears that no alterations in the old forms, therefore, are necessary. Fortunately the draft form submitted to us for approval ( enclosure to p.u.c.) is exactly the same as the old form except that it is on a j-di ger sheet of paper c.f. page flagged n N TT . In any case, since we are receiving separate returns for the reports to London, the old form can remain in use, because since the new form does not contain any improvement, and would be unsuitable for tiie size of our files^ it would be of no use customs incurring unnecessary expenditure simply to put the same thing on a larger sheet. We could, however, suggest that on the first page of the form donkeys should be excluded from the heading ^animals for slaughterv Draft for approval. t7 A / . /w. J J I. ^ 4 - /

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 10/3 VI Monthly trade statistics of imports and exports'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear of the file.
Foliation: the system in use appears in the top right corner of each folio, circled.

mods.abstract: Separate tables of imports from principal countries into, and exports to principal countries from the Bahrain Islands for each of the months October 1938 - December 1941, inclusive. Each set of statistics is accompanied by covering notes from the Director of Customs and Port Officer, Bahrain to the Political Agent, Bahrain, and from the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Indian Government Trade Commissioner, Alexandria, Egypt, with corresponding acknowledgements. The statistics record: articles and countries from which imported/to which exported; quantity; value; and total collections during same period the previous year.

name.namePart: Director of Customs and Port Officer
